title: 3D service/niche icons across UI + checkout auto-scroll to payment options

requirements.summary: Introduce a mapped 3D icon system for services and niches, render it consistently in required views, and provide a SafeImage-backed default fallback.
acceptanceCriteria: Services page cards show a 3D icon alongside each service (or a default 3D icon when no mapping exists).
ServiceDetailsDialog shows a 3D icon for the selected service in the header area (or default).
ServicesPricingPage shows a 3D icon for each of the 5 service categories and for Monthly Maintenance (or default).
Niche labels/filters (wherever they appear) display a mapped 3D icon (or default) without breaking layout on mobile.
All new icons are served as frontend static assets and rendered via the existing SafeImage component (or equivalent graceful fallback), so broken images do not show a browser broken-image icon.

Create centralized mapping utilities that resolve a service/niche value (serviceType/serviceSubType/name/niche) to a 3D icon static asset URL (using publicAssetUrl), including safe default fallbacks for service and niche icons.

Create a small reusable UI component that renders the resolved 3D icon via the existing SafeImage component (graceful fallback), supporting variants for service vs niche and consistent sizing for mobile layouts.

Render a 3D service icon on each service card (next to title/header area) using the new ServiceNiche3dIcon component and mapping utilities; also add a niche icon alongside the niche row when present, ensuring responsive layout.
Add a 3D service icon in the dialog header area (near the DialogTitle/description) using ServiceNiche3dIcon + mapping with fallback, keeping header layout stable on mobile.
Add 3D icons for each of the 5 service categories and for Monthly Maintenance (using category id/name mapping) in the relevant card/header areas via ServiceNiche3dIcon with default fallback.
Update niche filter UI to display a mapped niche 3D icon (or default) for the currently selected niche and/or within the niche dropdown list without breaking the existing mobile layout.
Wherever the lead niche is displayed as a label/badge, render the mapped niche 3D icon (or default) alongside it using ServiceNiche3dIcon, keeping spacing compact for mobile.

If needed to support the new 3D icon usage, adjust SafeImage to better handle tiny icon-sized placeholders (e.g., loading skeleton sizing), while preserving existing graceful fallback behavior and avoiding browser broken-image icons.

requirements.summary: Improve CheckoutDialog UX by automatically bringing payment options into view on open and payment instructions into view after order creation, for all entry points.
acceptanceCriteria: Opening CheckoutDialog automatically scrolls/focuses to the “Select Payment Method” section (payment options) without requiring manual scrolling.
After a successful “Create Order”, the dialog automatically scrolls/focuses to the payment instructions section for the currently selected method.
The behavior works for both ServicesPage checkout entry and ServicesPricingPage checkout entry, without changing backend APIs.
No user-facing text related to checkout becomes non-English as part of these changes.

file_operations.description: Add refs/anchors for the payment method section and the method-specific instructions section; on dialog open, automatically scroll/focus into the payment method section, and after successful order creation (and when switching payment method post-order), scroll/focus the relevant instructions into view, without changing any backend calls or user-facing copy.
